case_vignette: A 34-year-old woman presents with scaly lesions on the palms and soles. Lesions have been present for about a month. She denies recent genital sores or history of sexually transmitted diseases. She denies any family history of similar lesions on the palms or soles. She denies exposure to arsenic or well water. She denies being pregnant. She is otherwise healthy aside from a recent bout of stomach flu which she thinks she got from a bad piece of chicken. Physical examination reveals discrete scaly papules on the palms and soles.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have these rough, scaly patches on my hands and feet that have been there for about a month.
Have you noticed any itching or pain associated with these patches?
No, there's no itching or pain.

No, I haven't had any recent injuries or cuts on my hands or feet.

The only thing I can think of is a recent stomach flu after eating what I thought was a bad piece of chicken.
Have you had any other symptoms such as fever, chills, or fatigue?
No, I haven't had fever, chills, or fatigue.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms in the past?
No, there's no family history of similar issues on the hands or feet.
Have you had any allergies or skin conditions in the past?
I'm otherwise healthy and haven't had allergies or skin conditions in the past.
Final Diagnosis: Eczema.
